column18: 09/21/1972: A letter bomb addressed to Nahum Gershom, the Israeli Embassy Ambassador, was discovered and defused in Brazzaville, People's Republic of the Congo. This was one of 74 letter bombs that were mailed from Amsterdam and were discovered or detonated between September 19, 1972 and September 28, 1972. Black September claimed responsibility for the incidents.
